use wget <web path> to download files from Novogene if needed

Navigate to the Gopher raw reads on treebeard

log into treebeard and navigate to:
data/rocfish/EXP11_ScarnSmel_fluct_gill/P101HW18090797-01-01/

navigate into raw_data folders

gunzip files to compare read numbers/sizes to make sure that files were downloaded correctly

after unzipping use command to look for number of lines: 
wc -l/4 for each file

helpful to write loop that will: 
unzip file
count lines
append lines to new text file
zip file

also look at each file with head and tail, line count

Trinity v 2.5.1 script (via location on Khaleesi):
(to see what version, type /opt/trinityrnaseq/Trinity --version)
```{bash}

/opt/trinityrnaseq/Trinity --trimmomatic --seqType fq --max_memory 50G --SS_lib_type RF \
--left SC_R_1.fq.gz, SC_U_1.fq.gz, SC_E_1.fq.gz, SC_C_1.fq.gz \
--right SC_R_2.fq.gz, SC_U_2.fq.gz, SC_E_2.fq.gz, SC_C_2.fq.gz \
--CPU 10 --full_cleanup 
```
to run over a series of days in the background, you can use screen or NoHangup: 
might need to add perl
```{bash}
nohup perl /opt/trinityrnaseq/Trinity --trimmomatic --seqType fq --max_memory 50G --SS_lib_type RF \
--left SC_R_1.fq.gz, SC_U_1.fq.gz, SC_E_1.fq.gz, SC_C_1.fq.gz \
--right SC_R_2.fq.gz, SC_U_2.fq.gz, SC_E_2.fq.gz, SC_C_2.fq.gz \
--CPU 10 --full_cleanup --ouput Gopher_HMD_Trinity > Gopher_HMD_Trinity_out.txt 2>&1 &
```
after running you will get a code, make sure to write the code down so that you can go back to look at the right one

View the ouput file to check status
```{bash}
tail Gopher_HMD_Trinity_out.txt
```

Compute assembly stats
```{bash}
mv Trinity.fasta Gopher_HMD_Trinity.fasta
perl /opt/trinityrnaseq/util/TrinityStats.pl Gopher_HMD_Trinity.fasta
```
then copy the output information
